# init(target:clippingMode:crossingMode:)

**Initializer**

Creates a portal component with a target entity, clipping mode, and crossing mode.

## Declaration

```swift
init(target: Entity, clippingMode: PortalComponent.ClippingMode, crossingMode: PortalComponent.CrossingMode)
```

## Parameters

- **target**: A target world entity the portal is looking into.
- **clippingMode**: A configuration for the portal’s clipping feature.
- **crossingMode**: A configuration for the portal’s crossing feature.

## Discussion

To render a portal, an entity needs a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent] and a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ModelComponent], using one or more [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalMaterial] instances.

The target entity needs to have a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/WorldComponent] or the portal does not render.

Provide [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/ClippingMode-swift.enum] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/CrossingMode-swift.enum] to configure the corresponding clipping and crossing features.

Using this initializer is equivalent to setting [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/targetEntity], [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/clippingMode-swift.property] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/crossingMode-swift.property] properties directly.

See [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent] for example usage.
